meanings.definition: A person who buys and sells old or worn-out horses.
meanings.sent1: The knackers came to the farm to take the tired horse away.
meanings.sent2: The knackers sold the old horse to a new owner.
meanings.sent3: The knackers joked that they could turn the worn-out horse into a racehorse.
meanings.sent4: The knackers' business thrived as they found value in every old horse.
meanings.sent5: The image of the knackers leading the tired horse away stayed in my mind.

meanings.sent1: After running for hours, the long race knackered the runner.
meanings.sent2: I always feel knackered after a busy day at work.
meanings.sent3: The intense workout completely knackered me, but I felt accomplished.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending tasks at work can really knacker a person out.
meanings.sent5: The long hike up the mountain knackered my legs, but the view was worth it.

meanings.sent1: The boxer took a hard hit to the knackers during the match.
meanings.sent2: He winced in pain after accidentally hitting himself in the knackers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made a joke about getting kicked in the knackers.
meanings.sent4: The athlete protected his knackers during the game to avoid injury.
meanings.sent5: The cartoon character's exaggerated reaction to getting hit in the knackers made everyone laugh.
